item.title: 债券交易员迎接重要一周，赌注被收回
item.description: 在连续数周推动国债收益率走高后，交易员们在美国大选前纷纷撤出筹码，不愿在总统竞选悬而未决的情况下大胆押注债券。【原文：After driving Treasury yields higher for weeks, traders are taking chips off the table before the US election, reluctant to take bold bond bets with the presidential race too close to call.】

item.title: 欧佩克+再次推迟重启供应，原油价格陷入困境
item.description: 欧佩克+"同意将 12 月份的增产计划推迟一个月，这是欧佩克恢复供应计划的第二次推迟，因为在经济前景脆弱的情况下，价格仍在苦苦挣扎。【原文：OPEC+ agreed to push back its December production increase by one month, the second delay to its plans to revive supply as prices continue to struggle amid a fragile economic outlook.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行英国分行多年落后后面临新挑战
item.description: 桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）对其英国业务的不满情绪正在积聚，上周的裁员和昂贵的汽车金融审查只是让高管们头疼的最新事件，因为他们把其他国家放在了更优先的位置。【原文：Banco Santander SA’s frustrations with its British business are piling up, with job cuts and an expensive car finance review last week just the latest headaches for executives as they make other countries more of a priority.】

item.title: 巴菲特的 "蓝点 "奥马哈乐于成为总统的焦点
item.description: 奥马哈因其美味的牛排和亿万富翁投资者沃伦-巴菲特的故乡而闻名于世。但本周末，当地人正津津乐道于美国总统大选的焦点时刻。【原文：Omaha is best known for its good steaks and being billionaire investor Warren Buffett’s hometown. But this weekend, the locals are relishing their moment in the US presidential spotlight.】

item.title: 巴西财政部长应卢拉要求取消欧洲之行
item.description: 巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）取消了本周的欧洲之行，原因是雷亚尔汇率持续下跌，而且政府考虑削减的开支数额也存在不确定性。【原文：Brazil’s finance minister Fernando Haddad has canceled a trip to Europe this week amid extended losses of the real and uncertainty over the amount of spending cuts the government is considering.】

item.title: 大选焦虑笼罩新兴市场，投资者纷纷降低风险
item.description: 从墨西哥城到上海，经历了一年动荡的贸易商们正准备迎接新的政治冲击：美国总统大选有可能颠覆全球贸易，并有可能扰乱发展中国家的经济前景。【原文：From Mexico City to Shanghai, traders whipsawed by a volatile year are preparing for a fresh political jolt: A US presidential election that’s threatening to upend global trade and potentially roil the economic outlook across the developing world.】

item.title: 苹果终于通过新款 Mac Mini 找到了自己的游戏控制台
item.description: 新款 Mac mini 可能成为苹果对 PlayStation 和 Xbox 期待已久的回应。还有该公司计划于 12 月初推出下一个人工智能功能；发布令人失望的盈利指引并同意收购 Pixelmator；Peloton 的新首席执行官是苹果公司的前服务继承人。【原文：The new Mac mini could become Apple’s long-awaited answer to the PlayStation and Xbox. Also: The company’s next AI features are planned for early December; it delivers disappointing earnings guidance and agrees to acquire Pixelmator; and Peloton’s new CEO is Apple’s former services heir apparent.】

item.title: 华尔街的眼睛盯着大选，钱却不那么重要
item.description: 还剩一个交易日。周二，美国选民将开始挑选下一任总统，并有可能决定未来四年的经济走向。【原文：One trading session left. That’s all Wall Street has before Tuesday, when US voters begin the process of picking their next president and potentially determining the direction of the economy for the next four years.】

item.title: 中国敦促捷克政府帮助解决与欧盟的电动汽车争端
item.description: 中国商务部网站周日发布声明称，中国正敦促捷克政府发挥积极作用，帮助解决与欧盟之间有关电动汽车的贸易争端。【原文：China is urging the Czech government to play an active role in helping resolve the trade dispute with the European Union over electric vehicles, according to a statement posted on the Ministry of Commerce’s website on Sunday.】

item.title: 沙特 PIF 购入股份，中东顶级广播公司跃升 10
item.description: 在沙特阿拉伯王国主权财富基金同意以约 20 亿美元的价格从政府手中收购该公司的多数股权后，这家中东最大的广播公司在沙特阿拉伯的股价飙升了 10%。【原文：The Middle East’s biggest broadcaster surged as much as 10% in Saudi Arabia after the kingdom’s sovereign wealth fund agreed to buy a majority stake in the company from the government for about $2 billion.】

item.title: 媒体报道称香港被查封公寓以 1,400 万美元售出
item.description: 据多家当地媒体援引美联物业公司（Midland Realty）的报道称，被债权人查封的一套香港豪华公寓以 1.1 亿港元（约合 1410 万美元）的价格售出，比两年前的要价便宜了近 40%。【原文：A Hong Kong luxury apartment seized by creditors was sold for HK$110 million ($14.1 million), an almost 40% discount from its asking price two years ago, according to several local media reports, citing Midland Realty.】

item.title: 美联储和同行将在本周美国大选后继续降息
item.description: 人们普遍预计，美联储和许多富裕国家将在下周美国总统大选后再次降息。【原文：The Federal Reserve and many rich-world peers are widely expected to lower interest rates again in the coming week, right after a US presidential election that may not be decided yet.】

item.title: 德国银行开始削减引发债券动荡的美国办公楼贷款风险：信贷周刊
item.description: 在对商业房地产损失的担忧导致 2 月份债券和股票价格暴跌之后，德国银行正在削减遗留的美国办公楼贷款风险。【原文：German banks are cutting legacy US office loan exposure after concerns about commercial real estate losses led to a plunge in bond and equity prices in February.】

item.title: 马来西亚总理下令对亏损企业进行主权基金审计
item.description: 马来西亚总理安瓦尔-易卜拉欣下令主权财富基金 Khazanah Nasional Berhad 进行内部审计，调查与 4390 万林吉特（1000 万美元）投资损失有关的问题。【原文：Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim ordered sovereign wealth fund Khazanah Nasional Berhad to carry out an internal audit to investigate issues related to 43.9 million ringgit ($10 million) in investment losses.】

item.title: 科技股盈利未能激发交易员的超高预期
item.description: 投资者原本希望全球五大公司的盈利能使股市摆脱低迷，为 S&P 500 指数带来新的刺激。【原文：Investors had hoped earnings from five of the world’s biggest companies would shake the stocks out of a malaise and provide a fresh jolt for the S&P 500.】

item.title: 亿万富翁莫特塞佩因 1.95 亿美元的坦桑尼亚诉讼案被告上法庭
item.description: 南非亿万富翁帕特里斯-莫采佩及其关联公司在坦桑尼亚被起诉，索赔 1.95 亿美元，这是坦桑尼亚商业法庭受理的最大诉讼之一，将于周一开庭。【原文：South African billionaire Patrice Motsepe and his associate companies are being sued for $195 million in Tanzania, with one of the biggest suits to appear in front of the country’s commercial court set to resume on Monday.】

item.title: 土耳其 10 月贸易赤字收窄 13%，进口降幅放缓
item.description: 土耳其 10 月份的贸易逆差为 57.5 亿美元，进一步缩小，表明经济的再平衡仍在进行中。进口降幅是过去六个月中最慢的，反映了土耳其里拉的相对强势。【原文：Turkey posted a trade deficit of $5.75 billion in October, a further narrowing that suggests the economy’s rebalancing remains on track. The decline in imports was the slowest over the past six months, reflecting the relative strength of the Turkish lira.】

item.title: 毛里求斯经审查后取消社交媒体禁令
item.description: 毛里求斯取消了不到 48 小时前因政府所谓的网络恐怖主义风险而实施的社交媒体访问限制。【原文：Mauritius lifted restrictions on social media access imposed less than 48 hours prior due to what the government called cyber-terrorism risks.】

item.title: 德国摇摇欲坠的联盟将面临 750 亿欧元的预算清算
item.description: 德国政府正在为一项关键的法院裁决做准备，这项裁决可能会从国库中剥夺多达 750 亿欧元（820 亿美元）的税收收入，并有可能在距离大选仅剩一年的时间里使饱受打击的联盟陷入困境。【原文：The German government is bracing for a crucial court ruling that could strip as much as €75 billion ($82 billion) of tax income from the public coffers and potentially put the battered coalition in jeopardy with just a year to go until elections are scheduled.】

item.title: TGI Friday's 成为最新破产的休闲餐饮连锁店
item.description: 休闲连锁餐厅 TGI Friday's 公司申请破产保护，此前该公司一直在努力扭转业务颓势，原因是越来越注重成本的消费者在外出就餐时变得更加挑剔，或者更喜欢提供更快捷食物的竞争对手。【原文：Casual restaurant chain TGI Friday’s Inc. filed for bankruptcy protection after struggling to turn around a business pressured by increasingly cost conscious consumers who’ve either become more selective when dining out or prefer competitors that provide faster food.】

item.title: 瑞典 10 月份住房价格涨势好于往年
item.description: 瑞典国有银行瑞典储蓄银行（SBAB）的数据显示，瑞典房价在 10 月份保持温和回升，这是北欧国家房地产市场典型的疲软月份。【原文：Swedish home prices maintained their modest recovery in October, a typically weak month in the Nordic country’s housing market, according to data from state-owned bank SBAB.】

item.title: 西班牙努力应对造成数百人死亡的洪灾
item.description: 山洪暴发三天后，瓦伦西亚省东部的一个小镇乌蒂尔（Utiel）被洪水席卷，志愿者们在废墟中跋涉，帮助清理破碎的家具，铲走泥土。【原文：Three days after flash floods swept through Utiel, a tiny town in the eastern province of Valencia, volunteers trudged through debris to help clear broken furniture and shovel away mud.】

item.title: 失宠的三箭公司创始人妻子出售价值 3800 万美元的新加坡豪宅
item.description: 加密货币对冲基金三箭资本（Three Arrows Capital）倒闭，其联合创始人朱苏（音译）的妻子以 5100 万新元（约合 3850 万美元）的价格成功出售了她在新加坡拥有的一栋豪宅，尽管法院对这对夫妇的其他一些资产实施了冻结。【原文：The wife of Zhu Su, the co-founder of collapsed cryptocurrency hedge fund Three Arrows Capital, has managed to sell a mansion she owns in Singapore for S$51 million ($38.5 million), despite a court-imposed freeze against some of the couple’s other assets.】

item.title: 美国监管机构拒绝亚马逊-塔伦核电协议
item.description: 联邦能源管理委员会（Federal Energy Regulatory Commission）拒绝了一项允许亚马逊公司（Amazon Inc.com）数据中心直接从宾夕法尼亚州核电厂获取电力的协议。【原文：The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission rejected an agreement that would have allowed an Amazon Inc.com data center to directly tap into power from an Pennsylvania nuclear plant.】

item.title: 波音银行家攫取高达 3 亿美元的集资费用
item.description: 就在美国大选前股市发行开始降温之际，波音公司 200 多亿美元的增资为四家银行带来了丰厚的回报。【原文：Boeing Co.’s $20 billion-plus capital raise delivered four banks a hefty payday just as equity market issuance began to cool ahead of the US election.】
